title: Thread 'rustc' panicked at 'failed to lookup `SourceFile` in new context'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

You can reproduce it as follows

```Rust
cargo new this_will_panic
mkdir test
touch test/test_config.rs

#[cfg(test)]
#[path = "./simple_test.rs"]
mod simple_test_2;

touch test/simple_test.rs
#[test]
fn test_simple() {
    assert_eq!(2 + 2, 4);
}

Cargo.Toml


[[test]]
name = "test"
path = "./test/test_config.rs"
edition = "2018"

[package]
name = "compiler_error"
version = "0.1.0"
authors = ["Corfucinas <53630064+Corfucinas@users.noreply.github.com>"]
edition = "2018"

[dependencies]


run 'cargo test'

change 
path = "./test/test_config.rs"
to
path = "./test/test_config_2.rs"

change
test/test_config.rs
to
test/test_config_2.rs

run 'cargo test'

```


### Meta

Yes, the bug is on nightly

```
rustc 1.53.0-nightly (9d9c2c92b 2021-04-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 9d9c2c92b834c430f102ea96f65119e37320776e
commit-date: 2021-04-19
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.53.0-nightly
LLVM version: 12.0.0
```

### Version

Also on stable

```
rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2fd73fabe469357a12c2c974c140f67e7cdd76d0
commit-date: 2021-03-23
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.51.0
LLVM version: 11.0.1
```
